crazyballrun.game.controls

Class ControlEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • crazyballrun.game.controls.ControlEngine

  • public class ControlEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    The ControlEngine is initialized by the game, which fills the EventMapper with data according to the game configuration file and gives a list of IControl-instances to the engine. For other classes the control engine offers an interface for even-registration and -deregistration.
    See Also:
    EventMapper

      • getInstance

        public static ControlEngine getInstance()
        Gives access to the control engine of the game.
        Returns:
        a reference to the control engine.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(EventMapper eventMapper,
              java.util.ArrayList<IControl> controls)
        Initializes the ControlEngine by filling the control-hashmap and the EventMapper.
        Parameters:
        eventMapper - reference to the filled EventMapper
        controls - list of all IControl-implementations

      • register

        public void register(IListener listener,
            java.lang.String control,
            java.lang.String event)
        Registers a listener for a particular event of a control.
        Parameters:
        listener - reference to the listener
        control - ID of the control
        event - name of the event

      • deregister

        public void deregister(IListener listener,
              java.lang.String control,
              java.lang.String event)
        De-registers a listener from a control for a particular event.
        Parameters:
        listener - reference to the listener
        control - ID of the control
        event - name of the event

      • notify

        public void notify(java.lang.String control,
          java.lang.String event,
          EventContent content)
        Notifies the ControlEngine of an incoming event of a particular control. The ControlEngine passes the control- and event-name to the EventMapper which forces an action for the event.
        Parameters:
        control - ID of the control
        event - name of the event
        content - reference to the event's content
